remarks: For sequences that correspond to valid integers, the sequence multiplication function produces the sequence for the product.  This is effectively a proof of the correctness of the multiplication process, implemented in terms of logic gates for ~ df-sad , whose correctness is verified in ~ sadadd . Outside this range, the sequences cannot be representing integers, but the ` smul ` function still "works".  This extended function is best interpreted in terms of the ring structure of the 2-adic integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2016.)
statement: smumul $p |- ( ( A e. ZZ /\ B e. ZZ ) -> ( ( bits ` A ) smul ( bits ` B ) ) = ( bits ` ( A x. B ) ) ) $.
